definition: twelfth lunar month
old variant of 臘|腊[la4]/12th lunar month
dried meat/also pr. [xi2]
12th lunar month/preserved (meat, fish etc)
moon/month/monthly/CL:個|个[ge4],輪|轮[lun2]
final days of the lunar year

sentences.english: You say, when the severe winter, will accompany me to see the flying snow.
sentences.chinese: 你说，待到寒冬腊月时，就陪我去看那场飞天雪地吧。

sentences.english: He loafed through the winter months.
She was in severe winter and spring in March.
sentences.chinese: 她在寒冬腊月奔放，又在阳春三月凋落。

sentences.english: In Japan, this special auspicious day.
sentences.chinese: 腊月日，这个特别吉祥的日子。

sentences.english: Plums blossom from the 12th lunar month to the second month of the next year.
sentences.chinese: 梅花会从农历腊月一直开到第二年二月。

sentences.english: After six years of strict discipline, he finally realized his dream of full enlightenment on the eighth day of the twelfth lunar month.
sentences.chinese: 后经六年苦行，终于在腊月初八这一天悟道成佛。

sentences.english: It happened in a cold December.
sentences.chinese: 这事发生在一个寒冬腊月。

sentences.english: In the severe winter, the cold wind outside pricks people.
sentences.chinese: 寒冬腊月，外边冷风袭人。

sentences.english: The 23rd day of the 12th lunar month is called Preliminary Eve .
sentences.chinese: 在农历腊月23日人们会祭灶王爷。

sentences.english: Young people, even in deepest winter wheat also prefer iced tea.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人即使在寒冬腊月也偏爱冰镇麦茶。

sentences.english: Calculating by heart, it's late winter, and the last month of the lunar year is coming hitchily.
sentences.chinese: 屈指算来，已是深冬，阴历腊月的脚步在蹒跚走来。

definition: eleventh lunar month
first month of the lunar year
the traditional Chinese calendar/the lunar calendar
New Year's Day in the lunar calendar
lunar New Year's Eve
last day of the lunar year/Chinese New Year's Eve
Lidong or Start of Winter, 19th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-21st November
nine periods of nine days each after winter solstice, the coldest time of the year
Spring Festival (Chinese New Year)
Winter Solstice, 22nd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 22nd December-5th January
old calendar/the Chinese lunar calendar/same as 農曆|农历[nong2 li4]
the New Year festival
lunar New Year
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
nine periods of nine days each after winter solstice, the coldest time of the year
midwinter/the depth of winter
